title: Problem 2106_E
statement: Wolf has found n sheep with tastiness values p_1, p_2, ..., p_n where p is a permutation^{\text{∗}}. Wolf wants to perform binary search on p to find the sheep with tastiness of k, but p may not necessarily be sorted. The success of binary search on the range [l, r] for k is represented as f(l, r, k), which is defined as follows:If l > r, then f(l, r, k) fails. Otherwise, let m = \lfloor\frac{l + r}{2}\rfloor, and: If p_m = k, then f(l, r, k) is successful, If p_m < k, then f(l, r, k) = f(m+1, r
